instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: screen connector for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
hi , 
          i have got a 2012 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> , <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b board and it was liquid damaged , screen cable and connector both damaged , As no 2012 screen connector (silver styled) is available anywhere in uk. so now planning to replace the connector with the older type(golden) connector rather than 2012 (silver) connector and fit the old 2011 (golden) type cable . 
i hope u guys can understand what i have written above .

has anyone tried that and is it ok as i am assuming that there isnt anything different in the screen pins layout .
kindly advise
thanks

threads.title: screen connector for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: It's fine but you should change the cable too.

threads.title: screen connector for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
thanks for the reply , 
yes i am changing the cable . :)
